section.hand:
To S
r
Francis Walsingham Au
g
15 July

page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 15 Au
g
To M
r
Secretary Walsingham
Yt may please yo
r
H. this day
e
generall States
have sent
me a coppy of
e letter to hir
Ma
ty
,
wh
r
in they resolve astouching
the Articles, wherof I have also sent yo
r
H.
e coppy as I Rxd yt
from them. Howbeit as I signified in my last unto yo
w
their letter
was sent awaie at
e least 5 daies before they sent me the coppie
to th'end no doubt that they might not be p
r
vented by any note or
advertisement
t
I might writ upon yt from hens. I did alwaies stand in
doubt
t
they had not sent yt to theyr principals, w
ch
now is very easy
to be seen by the forme of their answer. as likewise for
t
otherwise
they would have signified e Answer of theyr principals, but all
their dealing is but dalliance considering they might have answered
as they do a great while since, & not hold hir Ma
ty
so long in
suspense in matt
rs
of such moment, &
t
required such speed.
There is nothing more certaine then that if they could obteyn those first
request
, w
ch
their l
re
doth mention. they will never bring
e articles
into treaty. In my last I gave yo
r
H. to understand of
e
exceding weake state of
e forces of these contreys. of a 1500 Flemishe
w
ch
I signified th
e
upon report of
e
Counsell
to be w
th
Count Maurice
I do since und
r
stand by a letter from the Count to
e Councill that
they were never more then 1000 of w
ch
he made [.] to have
sent 500 into
[Amsterdam],
but he hath since und
r
stood whereof he
could not have [.] but 5 daies after that there entred no more
into
e Towne but 140 the rest being taken & killed by
e Enemy
so that there are now lese of
e Flemish companies w
th
e Count
500 w
ch
togeth
r
w
th
e English may reatche to 1300 w
ch
ar all that
ar about
Gorchum
w
th
Count Maurice. & by all
e Enquiry
t
I
can make there are very few more, then as many more that can
be spared fr
o
theyr garrisons in all these provinces. Unles it
were 500 horse or th
r
about
w
ch
is all that they can make & leave
their garrisons furnished w
th
some 100 more. Besides the horse of
e
English w
ch
I was the willinger to signify thus p
r
cisely that yo
r
H might ob
s
ve how much hir Ma
ty
is wronged by
e Deputies report
The Count doth send us word
t
the Ennemy doth send of his forces
toward
Heel,
w
ch
he also writeth canot hold out long yf yt come to
battery. The
french Embassad
r
hath had no answer as yet
but for ought I can
ceave they are willing enough to accord his
request, yf they knew w
ch
waie to make any mony. It is thought by
some
t
they will gather yt abroade by the Pole not by forcing any
man, but by waie of Benevolence.
& thus referring yo
r
H to that w
ch
I have written furd
r
to my L Treasurer
I take my humble leave. From
e Hage Aug 15. 89.
Postscript
I am ev
r
y day & earnestly sollicited by
e English comp
s
t
s
ve w
th
S
r
M
r
tin S chenck
to become a sutor in they behalf that
in regard of
e service, & of
e travell & losse w
ch
they have
susteyned, they might receave some extraordinary reliefe uppon
theyr payment.
S
r
John Pooly
writeth that of 120 horses w
ch
he caried forthe there are scarsely 50 retourned.
